items.title: Agri Picks Report March 25, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The Securities and Exchange Board of India has extended the suspension of derivatives trade in wheat, chana, moong, paddy (non-basmati), mustard seeds and its derivatives, soya bean, and crude palm oil by another year, till Mar. 31, 2026, the regulator said in a release on Monday. In 2021, the government had imposed a ban on derivatives trading in the seven commodities for a year to check rising prices.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty Regain Momentum & Close Above 23,800? Ashok Leyland In Focus| Opening Bell
items.description: The Nifty 50 briefly crossed the 23,800 mark in the morning but struggled to hold onto gains due to profit-taking, ultimately closing flat with a positive bias on March 25. The consolidation was expected, yet the overall trend remains strong as the index has maintained a higher tops-higher bottoms pattern for six consecutive sessions while staying above key moving averages. Experts suggest that a decisive close above 23,800 is necessary for a rally toward 24,000; otherwise, consolidation may persist, with support at the 23,500-23,400 levels. However markets are on tenterhooks as the April 2 tariff deadline approaches. Trum has indicated that he will be more lenient than reciprocal. Also stocks in focus include Ashok Leyland, SML Isuzu, Maruti among others.

items.title: Live: Nifty Sees Triple-Digit Cut; Back Below 23,500|Swiggy, Zomato Extend Losses| Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty Sees Triple-Digit Cut; Back Near 23,500. Midcaps underperform; market breadth weak .NSE advance-decline ratio at 1:3. March records sharpest retail selloff since Dec 2023. Net selling in March stood at (R)10,500 cr. Autos, FMCG hold among sectoral gainers .IT, pharma & PSU banks under pressure .Zomato, Jio Fin to enter Nifty tomorrow .Britannia, BPCL to exit Nifty tomorrow .Zomato, Jio Fin set for inflows up to $400 million. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.
